title: Former French PM Lionel Jospin: 'The president is giving the Rassemblement National the opportunity to run for power. This is not responsible'
summary: Faced with the danger of the far-right coming to power, the former socialist prime minister says, in an interview with Le Monde, that the Nouveau Front Populaire is the only 'dam' that can stand in its way.

title: France braces for frenetic campaign as Mbappé calls on 'younger generation' to vote
summary: The football star said France was 'at a crucial moment' in its history, ahead of the shock snap elections on June 30 and July 7.

title: What we know about electoral projections for the upcoming French elections
summary: The snap elections of June 30 and July 7 are very difficult to predict given the high number of uncertainties on voter turnout and political alliances.

title: French protesters turn out in droves against far-right, caught between despair and the will to fight
summary: Over 250,000 people demonstrated across France on Saturday to show their opposition against the rise of the far-right ahead of parliamentary elections on June 30 and July 7.

title: 'The notion of protest vote tends to infantilize the voter, to depoliticize their action'
summary: Sociologist Jérémie Moualek tells Le Monde that most protests against politicians take place outside the framework imposed by elections.

title: French ex-president Hollande surprise candidate in snap elections: 'The situation is serious'
summary: 'An exceptional situation calls for an exceptional decision,' former French president François Hollande said on Saturday, announcing he will run as MP in the upcoming parliamentary elections.

title: 'This government must be changed,' say anti-Netanyahu protesters in Tel Aviv
summary: Every Saturday evening, Israelis gather to support hostage families, but also to demonstrate their discontent with the prime minister.

title: Euro 2024: runners-up England win over Serbia, Netherlands defeat Poland
summary: It was a good start for Gareth Southgate's squad, which has been touted as one of the tournament's favorites.

title: Downtown Chicago is being threatened by a real estate crisis
summary: With many offices deserted due to telecommuting, the Midwestern metropolis has seen its vacancy rate soar to 16.2%, while the national average is 13.8%.

title: As summer approaches, here are five garden festivals in France that you might enjoy
summary: 'La Matinale' invites you to escape to some very green places after this spring's rains, to be (re)visited under a long-awaited summer sun or when decked out in flamboyant autumn colors.

title: Ukraine summit paves way for peace talks with Russia
summary: Dozens of countries at the peace summit agreed that Kyiv should enter dialogue with Russia on ending the war, while strongly supporting Ukraine's territorial integrity.

title: In Nice, a 17th century monastery has been converted into a five-star hotel
summary: Valéry Grégo, an entrepreneur and founder of the Perseus group, is about to inaugurate the luxury Hôtel du Couvent. 40 years after the Visitandines left, the religious building will once again open its doors to the people of Nice and to travelers, with an approach centered on culture, food and care. A type of hospitality inspired by that of the nuns.

title: US-built jetty for Gaza aid has been nothing but a fiasco
summary: The US has failed miserably to send aid to Gaza by sea to bypass the obstacles placed by Israel to prevent it from reaching Gaza.

title: Norway gives $103 million to Ukraine to secure electricity
summary: Norway said it had already been decided that 120 million kroner, of the 1.1 billion kroner it will provide, would go toward repairs in the Kharkiv area, which has been hit particularly hard by Russian attacks recently.

title: France sees record number of imported cases of dengue fever
summary: While more than 6 million cases were reported in Brazil, at least 2,666 people reported the disease in France in 2024.

title: IOC gives 14 Russians, 11 Belarusians neutral status for Paris Olympics
summary: The International Olympic Committee unveiled a list of 14 Russian and 11 Belarusian athletes authorized to compete in the Paris 2024 Games, in four disciplines.

title: Ferrari win second successive Le Mans 24 Hours race
summary: Ferrari's No 50 car led from last year's winning No 51 car with under 120 minutes to go, from Toyota's No 7 then the No 2 Cadillac.

title: Belgium's federal parliamentary elections cause shock among population
summary: Proving the polls wrong, Wallonia swung to the right on Sunday to renew the House of Representatives. This result stunned the population, where the rise of the far right turned out to be weaker than expected.

title: Camels replace cows in Kenya due to climate change
summary: Three years of drought have decimated cattle herds in the Samburu region. Herders are now investing in one-humped camels whose highly sought-after milk is increasingly consumed.

title: What's a cohabitation in French politics and what are the precedents?
summary: In the history of the Fifth Republic, there have been three cohabitations, a term used in France when the president and prime minister come from opposing political camps. Emmanuel Macron's call for snap parliamentary elections could lead to a fourth.

title: Maryland governor will pardon 175,000 marijuana convictions
summary: In an interview with the 'Washington Post', governor Wes Moore says he intends to 'right a lot of historical wrongs'.

title: The temptation of nuclear power in Giorgia Meloni's Italy
summary: After the Chernobyl and Fukushima accidents, the country said no to nuclear power in a referendum. Energy Minister Gilberto Pichetto Fratin told 'Le Monde' that his government is determined to reintroduce 'a share of nuclear power.' But this change poses a legal challenge.

title: Philippine and Chinese chips collide near contested reef
summary: After an incident near the hotspot Second Thomas Shoal, located in the disputed South China Sea, the Chinese coast guard alleged that a Philippine resupply ship ignored their warnings, while the Philippines has accused China of 'continued aggressive actions.'

title: Russia sets US journalist Evan Gershkovich's trial date for June 26
summary: The Wall Street Journal reporter, who was arrested in March 2023 on charges of espionage at the CIA's behest, has been considered 'wrongfully detained' by the White House, and used as a bargaining chip by Putin to propose a prisoner exchange.

title: 'Judging Putin and Netanyahu necessarily implies a fair and adversarial trial'
summary: While the two leaders do not recognize the authority of the International Criminal Court, Sandrine de Sena, legal consultant before the ICC, analyzes the options that would enable them to be judged fairly, even in their absence.

title: Mbappé says he will not play at Paris Olympics
summary: France's captain confirmed Real Madrid would not free him for the Games in July and August.

title: Raphaël LLorca: 'It is as if Macron's act had psychologically authorized the liquidation of all political limits'
summary: The French president's decision has had the effect of plunging the political arena into a form of 'political psychosis,' opening up a window of opportunity that encourages all kinds of transgressions, writes essayist Raphaël LLorca.

title: Euro 2024: France makes entry accompanied by doubts and politics
summary: Les Bleus qualified brilliantly for the tournament in Germany, but have shown weaker form since then and will kick off the competition under the shadow of doubt. The political situation at home has also caught up with them.

title: EU passes biodiversity law as Austrian climate minister defies chancellor
summary: The legislation requires the European Union's 27 member states to put in place measures to restore at least 20% of the bloc's land and seas by 2030.

title: France's snap election campaign begins as deadline for registration passes
summary: Candidates had until Sunday evening to file paperwork. They now have less than two weeks before the first round of voting, on June 30.

title: Putin to make 'friendly' visit to North Korea
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin will visit the reclusive state on Tuesday as he seeks more ammunition to continue his invasion of Ukraine.

title: Hajj pilgrimage ends amid deadly Saudi heat spike
summary: Masses of pilgrims on Sunday embarked on a symbolic stoning of the devil in Saudi Arabia in scorching temperatures that have caused more than a dozen heat-related deaths.

title: 'Macron, who triggered this dissolution to trap the parties, has trapped himself'
summary: By accelerating the political realignment, the dissolution of the Assemblée Nationale is also bringing back the right-left divide Emmanuel Macron had sought to erase, explains Le Monde columnist Solenn de Royer.

title: Netanyahu dissolves Israel's war cabinet
summary: An Israeli government spokesman confirmed the Israeli prime minister had dissolved the war cabinet, following the resignation earlier this month of centrist leader Benn Gantz.

title: In Albania, 'Europe's last natural delta' is threatened by Donald Trump's son-in-law
summary: Jared Kushner has confirmed a $1 billion investment in luxury villas in an unspoiled area of the Albanian coast. NGOs have denounced an amendment of a law on 'protected areas,' allowing such developments to jeopardize the Vjosa Delta's biodiversity.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: Boats take part in Seine opening ceremony rehearsal
summary: A total of 55 boats, flanked by police, made the journey from the Pont d'Austerlitz to the Pont d'Iéna as the French capital prepares to hold a spectacular show to open the Games.

title: Ibrahima Konaté: 'The Euro is going to be harder than the World Cup'
summary: Ahead of France's European Championships opener against Austria on Monday evening, the central defender spoke to Le Monde about his rise role with Les Bleus, where he is once again vying for a starting position.

title: How Macron threw his supporters into a panic by calling snap elections
summary: President Emmanuel Macron's surprise announcement sent shockwaves through all levels of government. His coalition's ministers and lawmakers in particular experienced confusion, anger and fear, as many expected the move to backfire. Le Monde takes a deep dive into the hours that preceded and days that followed his decision.

title: Ukrainian pilots given an intensified training course in France to fly F-16s
summary: The French Air Force has committed to certifying the training of 26 Ukrainian pilots over a two-year period.

title: Austrian own goal helps France win first Euro 2024 match
summary: The win means three precious points for Les Bleus in an otherwise lackluster performance.

title: French architect Paul Chemetov has died
summary: A major figure in French architecture and urban planning, the architect died in Paris on June 16, aged 95. He was notably behind the design of France's Ministry of Economy and the renovation of the Grand Gallery of Evolution at the National Museum of Natural History.
